description:
Near the location of the Yurt near Cap 
Aux Meules, lies some of the tallest hills on 
the main island. There are even 
communications towers positioned at the 
top. The view from there makes for an 
incredible vista of the archipelago. Be there 
in the evenings and the sunsets are 
gorgeous. The entire set of islands stretch 
either way, and even Entree Island stands lit 
up in the setting sunlight, showing its red 
cliffs.

To reach this point, you can either take a 
small gravel road that leads to the towers, or 
you can take the foot path that leads from 
the yurt to truly experience the terrain. By 
foot, to see both the main hill as well other 
smaller ones, the return trip is around 1 Km. 
We found blueberries in the fields of pasture 
land, as well as a roving fox.
directions:
Leaving Cap 
aux Meules, take chemin de L'Eglise, Hermin 
Cormier, and then the dirt road called Butte 
de Vent.
title: Butte de Vent
